summary: Ann Furnald Taylor was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) from 1977 to 1978. Payroll certifications and related documents detail her employment, salary, and position within the committee. Her Social Security number was initially postponed from public release to protect her personal privacy, as indicated by a Final Determination Notification from the Assassination Records Review Board. She was also subject to background checks, as evidenced by correspondence and fingerprint analysis reports related to HSCA staff and applicants.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Ann Furnald Taylor's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, contributing to the investigation of President Kennedy's assassination. The documents highlight her role as a staff member and the administrative processes related to her employment, including payroll and background checks.
